Chance of a monkey getting the first character right: 1/44 Chance of a monkey getting all of the characters right: (1/44)140000*5 = 10-1150417 Number of characters that a monkey can type: 10 x 1018 = 1019 Number of sequences of 700000 characters: 1019 – 700000 = 1019 Probability of typing ToTC for 100 monkeys: 10-1150417 x 1019 x 100 = 10-1150396 What about for infinity monkeys? 10-1150417 x 1019 x infinity = infinity Probabilities greater than 1 Probabilities greater than 1 usually indicate that the event will occur multiple times during one measurement Probability of producing a positron: 0.94278 Probability of producing a 511 keV gamma is double https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Birthday_paradox_probability.svg/1280px-Birthday_paradox_probability.svg.png Probability of a pair of people having the same birthday reaches 50% for only 23 people – seems counterintuitive for 365 days: (23x22)/2 = 253 possible pairs! The atmosphere Ionosphere: essentially a mirror which reflects EM radiation of <40 MHz (> 7.5 metres) Stratosphere: region of the atmosphere where the ozone layer exists Troposphere: bottom few km of the atmosphere which we will focus on here https://ilearncana.com/upload/original/8352cdd9e03ef06d44b860024116e885.jpg Isothermal model of the atmosphere Assumptions: 1) Atmosphere is isothermal (in reality, dT/dh ~ 10 K km-1) [5.8] 2) Treat the atmosphere as consisting of an ideal gas (good assumption for majority of component gases at low pressure – not water vapour) 3) The Earth is flat (~15 km << 6400 km) 4) The atmosphere is stationary and thus in mechanical equilibrium dh Cross-sectional area A dh Cross-sectional area A 𝑃 = 𝜌𝑁𝑘𝐵𝑇 Number density (N/V) P(0) sea level P(dh) Forces: forces due to pressure and gravity (in equilibrium) 0 = 𝑃 0 𝐴 − 𝑃 ⅆℎ 𝐴 − 𝑚 𝜌𝑁 ⅆℎ 𝐴𝑔 0 = 𝑑𝑃𝐴 − 𝑚 𝜌𝑁 ⅆℎ 𝐴𝑔 Isothermal model of the atmosphere 𝜌𝑁 ℎ = 𝜌𝑁 0 ⅇ − 𝑚𝑔ℎ 𝑘𝐵𝑇 𝑃 ℎ = 𝑃 0 ⅇ− 𝑚𝑔ℎ 𝑘𝐵𝑇 𝑚𝑔ℎ 𝑘𝐵𝑇 must be dimensionless, and so 𝑘𝐵𝑇 𝑚𝑔 must have dimensions of h -> scale height, h0 ( at which P(h0) = P(0)e-1 ) Scale heights Particle Mass Scale height O2 gas 32 amu = 5.3137e-26 kg ~10 km N2 gas 28 amu = 4.6495e-26 kg ~10 km Covid virus ~10-18 kg ~0.5 mm Smallest known virus ~10-21 kg ~50 cm Bacteria ~10-15 kg ~5 μm Dr Stuart Pirrie ~102 kg ~50 ym (10-24 m is 1 ym)
